channel.title: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]
channel.description:
AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes
https://soundcloud.com/akaclavin/sunlight-in-my-eyes/s-hPtTi
  Draft 1, so more to do with the main instrumentation and drums. Will be finished with soulful male vocals.
Aiming for something that feels like a smooth techno remix of a vocal track. A simple structure, built on a chilled, uptempo groove.
Evoking hot, hazy, deamy summer days, with the scattered sunlight breaking through the trees or off the water, sparkling in your eyes.
…filtered through a slightly chilled clubbing energy, dancing on the beach in a sexy pair of shades.
  Let me know if I'm close to hitting it.
And, as always, all feedback welcome. :+1:

item.title: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
akabillposters:

Thinking I possibly need to juice up the Techno aspect a touch more – maybe through the drums.

That was actually the piece of feedback I had intended to leave, but became sidetracked…

Read full topic
item.source: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]

item.title: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Thanks, @blakkaz
Was hoping you’d take a look, seeing as Techno’s one of your things.

I started playing with a simple, two note bassline, padded it out with some simulated harmonics, which then led to the ‘ooh’ harmonies.
From that point, I wanted something synthetic for a bit of contrast, so added the skipping plucky synth notes. The vibe about where I wanted to take it sprung from that simple juxtaposition.

I wanted to go with the Techno influence as I thought the contrast was more interesting than simply making it a regular Ibiza-style Trance or Deep House track. I wanted something that felt like an authentic Techno remix of an Electronica/Electro-Pop crossover song.

I’ve reworked and rearranged it a bit since, mostly to bring the duration down, but I’m not sure if I’ve sacrificed the spirit of what I was trying to achieve – something that’s part song, part standalone (Summer) techno piece – with the non-vocal parts being sustained enough to for listeners to enjoy it as they would a Summer club instrumental – dare I say ‘anthem’.

Thinking I possibly need to juice up the Techno aspect a touch more – maybe through the drums.
Just needs a little more edge, more ‘bite’.

I’ll through up a link to a new revision in the next day or so. Would be good to get a second round of feedback, to know if I’m improving it – or going backwards.

Read full topic
item.source: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]

item.title: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
I absolutely loved the instrumentation choices you’ve made in this one.

It felt like the perfect mix of contemporary melodic techno (Kompakt/Ostgut Ton/Afterlife) with a touch of nostalgia (Vangelis). I’m curious as to the inspiration that lead you to make techno?

I feel like it might benefit from either an expansion of the current, or perhaps a secondary lead/melody introduced in the back half of the track…?

Also, as a personal preference, I’d love to hear this in the 125-130 bpm range.

Read full topic
item.source: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]

item.title: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
maybe an electric piano riff

Hah. I actually have one in the project, but I removed it from this arrangement.
It didn’t feel right. Even just the sounds made it feel a little too jazzy, softening any harder edge the track might still have – which I wanted to retain.

There’s a small chance it might reappear in the breakdown during the 3rd verse (3:33 – 4:01), but only a small chance as I’m more likely to use vocal layers under the main verse vocals.

Read full topic

item.title: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Thanks, @Produk.

 
Re: Drums

I want them to feel a little like they’re on rails. An engaging, but mostly unobtrusive rhythm groove that just keeps going and gives everything a bit of a shuffle.

 
Re: Stuttering impact

I’ll have a think about pulling that stuttering impact back a little, though I don’t want to smooth everything over.
I want to maintain a Techno element, rather than shift it to Deep House.

I’m inclined to think that it needs punctuation like that to stop it being a monotony of smooth vibes, if you catch my drift.

Same with the 1:54 addition, though that could possibly also be pulled back a little, or blended in a little more smoothly.

Issue is, if everything moves too smoothly between sections, then you don’t get that sudden injection of fresh energy and it starts to feel a little too much like one groove.

Also, worth keeping in mind that there will be vocals, so that 1:54 addition comes in as part of the shift from verse to pre-chorus. (That particular move from verse to pre-chorus appears twice in the piece.)

 
Conversely, I think the 2:15 – 3:19 section needs to step up a bit more. The chorus (2:22 – 2:50) is meant as a an incomplete step up in energy, because the real peak is that 2:15 – 3:19 section (also appears 4:30 – 4:58).

Maybe needs some rezzy chords underneath to make it a blissed-out section, in so far as this track has one.

Read full topic
item.source: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]

item.title: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]
item.dc:creator: Produk
item.description:
when the drums come in around 1min in, would reccomend adding some more variation in the percussion to make it sound more natural.

the thing, idk what to call it, countermelody? harmony? the stuttery thing that comes in at 1:29-ish, that sound you chose for it doesn’t feel quite right for this song. A bit too harsh or aggressive imo for something that seems more laid back.

especially that melody or whatever that comes in at 1:50 and re-appears in a few other places, do not make that appear so suddenly and with such sharp of a sound. It’s fine if it appears suddenly if it’s a gentle sound, and it’s fine if it fades in if it’s an aggressive sound(so the listener can get used to it)

otherwise sounds gr8

Read full topic
item.source: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]

item.title: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I’m thinking (hoping) that the length will feel mitigated by the vocal.
There are a couple of stretches where vocals will be, which might currently feel too long without that extra element in there.

If I was set on getting the duration down, I’d have to rethink most sections.
I’ll aim for the current length and structure, but consider a radio edit if it still feels long.

The challenge is that I want it to feel like a proper vocal track (verses, rather than 2 lines repeated throughout the track), but also feel like a Summer club track at the same time, so it needs to have sustained instrumental segments.

I’ll probably do some benchmarking for structure.

I have something fairly specific in mind for vocal delivery/style – lazy, sparse and soulful.
I’ll find a reference vocal as guidance for the vocalist.

 

it is a little harsh but it’s a good juxtaposition against how smooth everything else is.

As you say, it benefits by having something to change the energy slightly.

the intro melody is awesome (is that from the new pads?

More than half the sounds are from the new pack.

Read full topic
item.source: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]

item.title: AKA Clavin - Sunlight In My Eyes [WIP, Melodic Techno?]
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Lead at 2:28 awesome, love the tonality it is a little harsh but it’s a good juxtaposition against how smooth everything else is. When the shuffling percussion and drums come in I was like yeahhh this is nice, the intro melody is awesome (is that from the new pads? I didn’t try them out at all yet).

At first I thought it might be a bit long but you varied the sections up enough that it kept me going, sometimes my attention span is very short. I can definitely see some editing down once you get the vocals going but it’s not going to take anything away from it, it’ll just be done in a way that have the vocals pop and mix nicely with everything else you laid down here.

All I gotta say is - can’t wait to hear it with vox on top

Read full topic
